manifest.name: @panz3r/spotify-js
manifest.description: A module to interact with local running Spotify client using a simple API
manifest.readme: # SpotifyJS > A module to interact with local running Spotify client using a simple API ## Installation ```bash yarn add @panz3r/spotify-js ``` ## Usage ## Local Development This project was bootstrapped with [TSDX](https://github.com/jaredpalmer/tsdx). Below is a list of commands you will probably find useful. ### `npm start` or `yarn start` Runs the project in development/watch mode. Your project will be rebuilt upon changes. TSDX has a special logger for you convenience. Error messages are pretty printed and formatted for compatibility VS Code's Problems tab. Your library will be rebuilt if you make edits. ### `npm run build` or `yarn build` Bundles the package to the `dist` folder. The package is optimized and bundled with Rollup into multiple formats (CommonJS, UMD, and ES Module). ### `npm test` or `yarn test` Runs the test watcher (Jest) in an interactive mode. By default, runs tests related to files changed since the last commit.
